    ExecuteAsync(Func<Task>)
    ExecuteAsync(Func(Of Task))

    Repetitively executes the specified asynchronous task while it satisfies the current retry policy.

    public Task ExecuteAsync(Func<Task> taskAction)Public Function ExecuteAsync(taskAction As Func(Of Task)) As Task

    Parameters

    • taskAction
      Func<Task>
      Func(Of Task)

      A function that returns a started task (also refered as "hot" task).

    Returns

    • Task
      Task

      Returns a task that will run to completion if the original task completes successfully (either the first time or after retrying transient failures). If the task fails with a non-transient error or the retry limit is reached, the returned task will become faulted and the exception must be observed.

  • Edit

    Repetitively executes the specified asynchronous task while it satisfies the current retry policy.

      Func<Task>
      Func(Of Task)

      A function that returns a started task (also refered as "hot" task).

    • cancellationToken
      CancellationToken
      CancellationToken

      To cancel the retry operation, but not operations that are already in flight or that already completed successfully.

    Returns

    • Task
      Task

      Returns a task that will run to completion if the original task completes successfully (either the first time or after retrying transient failures). If the task fails with a non-transient error or the retry limit is reached, the returned task will become faulted and the exception must be observed.

      Task(Of TResult)

      Returns a task that will run to completion if the original task completes successfully (either the first time or after retrying transient failures). If the task fails with a non-transient error or the retry limit is reached, the returned task will become faulted and the exception must be observed.
